issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

projectCategory.description: Titanium and related SDKs used in application development
projectCategory.name: Client

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
H5.Description

The jsca file generated during the build process appears to missing the Windows specific namespaces from the {{Ti.App}} and {{Ti.UI}} namespaces.

This can be seen by opening up the {{api.jsca}} file under an SDK and searching for "Titanium.App.Windows" or "Titanium.UI.Windows", neither exist. I don't believe this to be a platform specific issue as the iOS namespaces appear in the jsca in the Windows zip. This causes problems for any products that make use of the jsca file (Studio, Atom plugin)
fields.summary: JSCA: Windows specific namespaces missing from file

comments.body: At a guess this might be down to the jsca being generated without the Windows docs maybe
